intro: Oreocharis elliptica, commonly known as the elliptic oreocharis, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It is often found in forested areas and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
